The Elder Nandaka’s Birth Story

analyzed: migaluddaḥ pure āsi  araññe kānane aha
translated: “Formerly I was a hunter,🔽in the forest, in the jungle;
Seeking to kill a deer,
I saw the Self-Arisen One.
The Awakened One named Anuruddha,
the Self-Arisen, the Unconquered One;
The Sage, desiring solitude,
then dwelled in the middle of the forest.
Taking four sticks,
I placed them in four places;
Having made a well-made pavilion,
I covered it with lotus flowers.
Having covered the pavilion,
I worshipped the Self-Arisen One;
Putting down the bow right there,
I went forth into homelessness.
Not long after going forth,
sickness arose for me;
Remembering my past deeds,
I died right there.
Bound by my past deeds,
I went to the Tusita heaven;
There, a golden bird
appears as I wish.
With a horse-drawn chariot yoked with a thousand (horses),
I resolved on a divine vehicle;
Having mounted that vehicle,
I go wherever I wish.
As I was leaving there,

analyzed: deva bhūtassa me sataḥ  samantā yojana sata
translated: and I became a god,
a pavilion was held over me🔽for a distance of a hundred leagues.
I lie on a bed here
covered with a canopy of flowers;
And lotuses from the sky
rain down on me all the time.
When the sun’s rays are spreading
and the heat is intense,
the heat doesn’t torment me,
this is the fruit of the pavilion.
I’ve gone beyond a bad destination,
and the lower worlds are closed to me.
Whether in a pavilion or at the foot of a tree,
I have no anxiety.
Having resolved on the perception of earth,
I cross over the salty ocean.
That good deed of mine
is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Having made a path where there was none,
I go without faltering.
Oh, what a good deed I did,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I know my past lives,
and my eye of the gods is purified.
My effluents are ended,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I’ve given up my former birth,
and I’m in the Buddha’s very presence.
I’m an heir to the true Teaching,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

analyzed: ārādhitaḥ asmi sugata  gotamam sakya puṅgava
translated: I have worshipped the Happy One,🔽the Gotama, the Sakyan bull;
I am the banner of the Dhamma, the heir of the Dhamma,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Having attended on the Buddha,
the Gotama, the Sakyan bull,
I asked the leader of the world
about the path that leads to the other shore.
The Buddha, the one who is attended on,
spoke the profound and subtle word.
Having heard that Dhamma from him,
I attained the destruction of the pollutants.
Oh, what a good deed I did,
I am freed from birth!
All the pollutants are destroyed,
there is no continuation of existence.
My defilements are burned up,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed was it to me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus did the Elder Nandaka chant these verses.
